page.title: 05FARMING
page.content: The main agricultural practice of the area is based on{arable farming}. The main crops are wheat, barley, sugar beet and potatoes. Other common crops include oil seed rape, onions, celery and carrots. The farming is very intensive with a high degree of investment especially in machinery. Specialist pieces of equipment such as sugar beet harvestors and drills have been designed in the locality for use on the land. High yields are obtained by the extensive use of fertlisers, pesticides and irrigation. The last of these is becoming more and more important as farmers try to maximise their yields and grow their crops under optimal conditions. Higher yields associated with high quality will ensure a goor return for the farmer. Some rough grazing of cattle takes place on the river banks/washes.
